info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Berks County through 545 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fleetwood, or 8 miles northeast of Reading, moving east at 15 mph. The Reading Regional Airport recently measured a 36 mph wind gust with this storm along with very heavy rainfall. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bally, Bechtelsville, Gilbertsville and Boyertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
